meanings.definition: The act of getting rid of something
meanings.sent1: Proper disposal of old electronics is important for the environment.
meanings.sent2: She always handles the disposal of trash in our house.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the disposal of leftover cake was swift and efficient.
meanings.sent4: The disposal of his old habits was a challenge he faced bravely.
meanings.sent5: The disposal of the evidence was crucial to solving the mystery.

meanings.definition: The power or opportunity to make use of something
meanings.sent1: Having the disposal of extra time allowed her to pursue new hobbies.
meanings.sent2: The disposal of resources is key to the success of any project.
meanings.sent3: With the disposal of his creativity, he painted a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: She had the disposal of a vast library of books to choose from.
meanings.sent5: The disposal of knowledge is a valuable asset in today's world.

meanings.definition: A device or system for getting rid of waste materials
meanings.sent1: The new disposal in the kitchen makes cleaning up after meals easier.
meanings.sent2: The disposal in the sink helps to prevent clogs in the pipes.
meanings.sent3: The disposal in the office break room is always kept clean and fresh.
meanings.sent4: He fixed the disposal in the garage to properly dispose of garden waste.
meanings.sent5: The disposal in the park ensures a clean environment for visitors.
